fields.description:
I've had several requests from users (and also personal pet peeves) about not being able to remove the page diffs from Confluence RSS feed subscriptions.

For awhile this was a minor inconvience and could effectively be ignored and put up with, but some users are starting to use hidden content such as the {htmlcomment:hidden} macro to add comments which don't get rendered to the user - however, when Confluence sends out its RSS feed with the raw page diffs - this hidden content is shown.

It would be good to be able to disable diffs from the RSS Feed Wizard.
fields.summary: (Optionally) Remove page diffs from being included in RSS feeds

fields.description:
The page history shows the change comments only for the last version although other versions have a comment.

The problem seems to be the getter getRenderedVersionComnent() in the class com.atlassian.confluence.core.VersionHistorySummary. The page viewpreviouspages.vm calls the method getRenderedVersionComment() in line 86.
fields.summary: Page history doesn't shows change comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8154].
  {panel}

This is a feature/enhancement request. 

It would be nice to have an Administrator link or identifier that tells space admin that they currently have permission in the space they are currently in as well as allow normal users to easily identify space admin or problems within a space. 

We rolled Confluence out by establishing space admins for each department. Although there is a wiki page, people new to the wiki have found it difficult knowing who to contact while in a space.

Also the space admin said they would prefer one click int he top right hand corner to access the administration rather then 3 to 4 click depends on what you want to change.  Having the administration be more embedded into the Space Admin and Administrator view rather then to have to navigate to a special section would improve the product.
fields.summary: Display who is the Space Admin while in a space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8153].
  {panel}

Confluence instances are licensed for a set number of users.  Administrators frequently ask how to remove one or more users so they can add new users without having to increase the number allowed by their licence.  Currently we tell them to effectively deactivate those users by removing the "Use Confluence" permission from them, both directly and via their inclusion in groups. http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Removing+a+User

The problem that many many administrators then face is that the number of users actively using the system is somehow cached.  (I believe it's their membership of groups that is the problem but I haven't checked).

This means that in order to add new users, they must:

1) remove permissions from existing users
2) wait a while (or clear the caches from the cache statistics page).
3) add new users.
fields.summary: Active User cache is not cleared when users are removed from groups

fields.description:
I searched for 

creating support request quick

in all spaces on extranet.  This line was included on the results page:
There is one match in another space. Include this result. 

With the Include this result link going to the page I was already viewing.

I'm guessing that the page is one I'm not allowed to see and that this is a bug in the new permissions stuff.
fields.summary: Link to results in other spaces given when searching all spaces

fields.description: Some of our users would like the ability to use the attachements macro in pages, but always have the display sorted by date (descending).
fields.summary: Enhance the attachment macro to include sort order

fields.description:
Pretty much described here CONF-877.

Email search is case sensitive, some users describe themselves as firstname.surname@cern.ch, others as Firstname.Sirname@cern.ch meaning I have to search twice if I am unlucky. Again regex, or Jira-like user search would be good.

Details on searching for a user is a bit sketchy, I can see add/remove/update, but nothing on "Search for a user", and I got lots. :(
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+User+Management
fields.summary: Email search is case sensitive, makes search difficult.
Remove page export action

fields.description:
The cluster safety job was initially intended to detect splits in a cluster. However, as it turns out, it also detects when a NON-CLUSTERED version of Confluence has been unintentionally deployed more than once. When these two or more non-clustered versions attempt to write to the same database simultaneously, the cluster safety job reports this error: 

2007-03-19 19:43:30,020 FATAL [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-0] [confluence.cluster.safety.ClusterPanicListener] handleEvent Fatal error in Confluence cluster: Database is being updated by an instance which is not part of the current cluster. You should check network connections between cluster nodes, especially multicast traffic. 

The cluster specific part of this message should be ignored for users who are using non-clustered versions. However, users must address the underlying issue: that somehow two instances of Confluence have been deployed that are are both writing to the database elected for Confluence. 

In future, we should rename the cluster safety job and make it throw the right johnson message depending on whether clustering has been enabled or not.
fields.summary: Cluster safety job should be made more generic and report multiple deployments with same DB as well

fields.description:
Space exports can only be imported into the same version of Confluence from which it was created. However, if a space export from an older version is imported, the following error is thrown:

"When Restore denied. Export type could not be determined. Check that exportDescriptor.properties file exists in export zip and is valid."

This error does not indicate the cause of the problem or suggest the solution. There should be a specific check that the space export is for an identical version, and if not, an error should inform the user why. For example

Space restore failed. 

Reason: 
Space XML export must be imported into an instance with the same version number as the instance that created it. Space imports cannot be imported into an older or newer release. 

Solution:
If the export was created on an *older* version of Confluence, please upgrade that instance to the same version and re-create the space XML export.
If the export was created on an *newer* version of Confluence, please upgrade this instance to the same version and re-attempt the import.
fields.summary: Error when importing space XML backup from an older Confluence version is incorrect

fields.description:
Text becomes unreadable if a system theme with dark input field background color is used.

The workaround is to set the browser to ignore colors specified by the site.
fields.summary: Background colors of input fields and textareas not specified in css

fields.description:
If we attempt to remove a Space and the Space has multiple versions of a template, we get the following error:
Cause:
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: (Hibernate operation): data integrity violated by SQL ''; nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Batch entry 7 delete from PAGETEMPLATES where TEMPLATEID=25 was aborted. Call getNextException to see the cause.
 at org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.java:93) 
caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Batch entry 7 delete from PAGETEMPLATES where TEMPLATEID=25 was aborted. Call getNextException to see the cause.
 at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement$BatchResultHandler.handleError(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:2497) 

We have to manually remove the templates from the DB.
fields.summary: Remove Space fails if there are multiple versions of a template in the Space.

fields.description: The current Export to XML or Backup functionality write to the Java Heap instead of writing to disk. This is a problem since there are memory limitations (especially on 32-bit systems) preventing us to export everything (we get JavaOutOfMemoryException). Please consider writing this output to disk instead.
fields.summary: Backup and Export to XML should write to disk instead of Java Heap

sensitivity_class_restricted.gif (image/gif, 1 kb) 

(see CONF-7611 )

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8137].
  {panel}

Currently there is no way to totally remove an existing user if such user has already created some content.
The alternative of deactivating the user addressed this problem just partially, those users can still get listed publicly, they are still somehow around the system.
This turns into a security issue.


Cheers!
Hernan

fields.summary: Upgrade to Tomcat 5.5.23 in standalone

fields.description:
The instructions for installing Confluence Standalone on OS X need updating.

Problem 1 - They cannot be edited since they are a PDF and the source is unavailable. The PDF content should be transferred across to a Confluence page.
Problem 2 - The JAVA_HOME reference may fail for some Mac installs. The line

JAVA_HOME=/System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Home

should be changed to

JAVA_HOME=/Library/Java/Home

Problem 3 - The install guide should note that the install and home paths should not contain spaces

Problem 4 - The content is unnecessarily wordy in places. It would be helpful to rewrite these instructions to be as concise as possible. Specifically, preamble in Step 7, differences between home and install in step 5, directions for editing in step 7, directions to run startup.sh step 9
fields.summary: OS X install instructions have unreliable JAVA_HOME reference, do not mention naming problem and PDF format is difficult to update

fields.description:
Following the install instructions for OS X, a user may create parent directory containing the home and install directories. If that or any parent directory contains a space, for example if the parent directory is called Confluence Server, the path is invalid. While Confluence appears to start up correctly when run, it actually fails without producing any output in the command window and logs an error "Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Server" where "Server" is the last word in the directory containing spaces.

The startup script should confirm that the Confluence paths are valid before attempting to use it. If either path contains spaces, it should output an error to the command window. 
"Problem:
Confluence cannot start because the Confluence install directory contains spaces. The install directory is \Some\Example Directory\Install

Solution:
Rename your install directory path so that there are no spaces, then restart Confluence"

After checking the install, it should check the Home path and throw the following error to the command window if invalid:

"Problem:
Confluence cannot start because the Confluence Home directory contains spaces. The Home directory is \Some\Example Directory\Home

Solution:
1) Rename your home directory path so that there are no spaces
2) Edit confluence-init.properties and update the path
3) Restart Confluence"
fields.summary: Startup.sh will accept invalid Confluence install directory paths instead of reporting the error

fields.description:
Link tips are listed as undefined pages in advanced tab.

For example, following the notation convention [link alias|pagetitle|link tip], I create a link (in the Navigation page for use in the Left Navigation Theme):

[Volunteers|Volunteer Directory|Search Volunteers here] // note that "Search Volunteers here" is a link tip, not a page.

with a page named "Volunteer Directory" already created. The space advanced tab then lists "Search Volunteers here" as an undefined page. Creating a page called Search Volunteers I find that the problem page is unlisted on undefined pages.

Workaround: use the same pagetitle as link tip.
fields.summary: Link Tip shows up as Undefined Pages

In the logs for a site backup restore, the following logs were reported: 

2007-03-19 21:59:30,452 WARN [confluence.importexport.impl.DeferredOperations] reportOutstandingOperations uncompleted deferred operations waiting for:[class = com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.DefaultHibernateExternalEntity, id = 2822]

This means that a DefaultHibernateGroup is still referencing a DefaultHibernateExternalEntity(2822) in its externalMembers collection, even though it no longer exists and could not be found in the backup. Does the removing of an external entity properly remove the entity from the collections it is associated with?

fields.description:
The activity plugin does not perform well on sites with large amounts of traffic, especially when a large volume of activity data has been accumulated.

The activity plugin uses a simple QueueExecutor which is queue of work handled by a single thread. I think it was implemented this way to guarantee single threaded writes to the index (and to offload the work from the thread generating the indexable event i.e. http workers)

The usage plugin index manager optimizes the index after every 15th write and on c.a.c. we have reached some tipping point where the optimization is taking longer then the amount of time in which the work queue is being filled. Bear in mind that the optimization is being conducted by the executor thread which is managing the work queue. Once the queue is full, any other thread trying to add work to the queue is blocked, and for a significant amount of time, stalling requests to the web app.

The main problems at the moment are:

1) We optimize on every 15th write in the usage plugin. Confluence 2.3 and beyond uses a compound index format which in turn allows us to optimize at a greatly reduced frequency.

2) Optimization of the usage plugin index on c.a.c is taking a fairly long time. This index is  ~2GB (!!) and growing. Contrast this with the main Confluence content index which is only ~200MB

3) Optimization in Confluence locks out use of the index until the optimization is finished.

4) The activity plugin index on c.a.c is not in compound index format. I think this may be because it started out life this way and it would require a fresh start to be built as a compound index. Problem: we can't just start again without losing all of the current usage statistics.

We could alleviate 1 by scheduling a job in the plugin to do the optimization but that relies on a solution to 4. Problem 2 is something we discussed at some point during the activity plugin integration. We really need an event horizon for usage events to be rolled up into more coarse grained aggregates.

Problem 3 is the killer though and is something that impacts Confluence as a whole. We *really* need to look at getting a solution like JIRAs ConcurrentLuceneConnection into Confluence ASAP.

The quickest thing we can do to at the moment to get the activity plugin back into production would be to change the queue policy to discard any new work when the queue is full. We might also want to reduce the optimization frequency. Having client threads do the work themselves when the queue is full is not an option as they will just block on the index manager anyway when optimization is occuring. 

We should also look to reduce the size of the activity index, it grows far too rapidly at the moment. We store events with accuracy to the second, this should be changed to the hour.
fields.summary: Improve activity plugin performance

fields.description:
From a Crowd support case:

"I have a given a regular expression for the directory where all these users are imported. Now after integration with crowd When I try to reset the password of a confluence user in confluence with invalid conditions( not according to regular expression given), Then I get the following exception with confluence System error page being displayed."

Cause:
com.atlassian.user.EntityException: Fault: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.exception.InvalidCredentialException: Fault: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.exception.InvalidCredentialException
at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.atlassianuser.CrowdUserManager.alterPassword(CrowdUserManager.java:170)

caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.exception.InvalidCredentialException: Fault: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.exception.InvalidCredentialException: Fault: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.exception.InvalidCredentialException
at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)

caused by: org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: Fault: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.exception.InvalidCredentialException
at org.codehaus.xfire.fault.Soap11FaultSerializer.readMessage(Soap11FaultSerializer.java:31)

---

Suggested fix:

1. Add a new subclass of EntityException called InvalidPasswordException
2. Throw InvalidPasswordException from CrowdUserManager.alterPassword()
3. Modify bucket's DefaultUserAccessor to rethrow InvalidPasswordException
4. Catch InvalidPasswordException in Confluence's ChangeUserPasswordAction and display a meaningful error message to the user.
fields.summary: Error page if new password doesn't match Crowd password validation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8062].
  {panel}

The "trash" can for deleted pages only shows:

1. The Page Title
2. Restore/Delete Options.

Ideally, what we'd like is for the activity of deleted pages to be logged, and that information displayed on the page. 

What we are looking for in addition to the 2 points listed above are:

1. The Timestamp of when the page was deleted
2. The User who deleted the page
3. Create a log file that will log this type of activity.
fields.summary: Logging and Extra Information for Deleted Pages Description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-8061].
  {panel}

Presently, there is no "fall-back" available when deleted entire spaces - i.e. once you remove a space it is deleted permanently. 

It would be helpful to have the "trash" feature like with deleting individual pages, so that Spaces which are removed can be restored with ease.

Ivan has suggested the following procedure:

1. Once a space is deleted, change the flag in the database table for that Space to "deleted"
2. Keep the Space in the table, but inactive.
3. Only delete the space permanently if the user "Purges" the trash.
4. Change the flag from "deleted" back to normal status, should the space be restored.
5. Log the activity of deletion; i.e. Log the timestamp for when the space was deleted, and by whom. 
6. Create a log file to log all this activity.
fields.summary: Rollback/Recovery option for Deleted Spaces

fields.description:
Currently this URL causes a 12 second slow-down when loading the edit page on extranet:

http://extranet.atlassian.com/includes/js/tiny_mce/zip_src?theme=advanced&language=en&plugins=table%2Cpaste%2Cemotions%2Cfullscreen%2Cconfluence

It is approx 300kb of content that is sent uncompressed, and sent every time (as it has the must-revalidate header):

Date: Tue, 13 Mar 2007 23:33:16 GMT
Server: Apache/2.0.52 (Red Hat)
X-Confluence-Cluster-Node: Member(Id=2, Timestamp=2007-03-09 04:22:50.186, Address=172.16.0.10:8088, MachineId=57135)
Cache-Control: must-revalidate
Expires: Wed, 14 Mar 2007 00:33:16 GMT
Content-Length: 302263
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/javascript

We should fix this to serve it through the caching servlet "/s".  To do this, we can't pass any parameters to the url, as by default, most browsers won't cache requests that have request parameters.

I'm raising this as a bug, as it causes severe performance penalties over slow connections.  300kb on every edit.
fields.summary: zip_src from tiny mce served without caching headers on extranet

fields.description:
We should assign the generated anchor name of a heading to its ID instead of using named anchor elements. Current behaviour:

A Heading

Improved behaviour:

A heading

This results in cleaner markup and is probably easier for WYSIWYG editors to grok. All modern browsers (and quite a few older ones) support id based anchors.
fields.summary: Use HTML id instead of empty named anchors in headings
